li.title: complex linear equation
li.p: a linear equation where the coefficients are complex numbers and the variables are allowed to take on complex values

li.title: complex matrix
li.p: a matrix whose entries are complex numbers

remark.p:
Remember that a real number is just a special kind of complex number. Therefore,
every linear equation with real coefficients can be considered as a complex linear equation by allowing the variables involved to take on complex values; and
every matrix whose entries are real numbers can also be considered as a complex matrix.

li.title: complex conjugate of a matrix A
li.p: the matrix \cconj{A} obtained by replacing each entry by its complex conjugate

li.title: (complex) adjoint of a matrix A
li.p: the matrix \adjoint{A} obtained by taking the transpose of the conjugate of A, \adjoint{A} = \utrans{\cconj{A}}

li.title: self-adjoint matrix
li.p: a complex matrix that is equal to its own complex adjoint; also referred to as a Hermitian matrix complexmatrixHermitian matrixHermitian
